It's been a while since I've written here.  Things are proceeding at a pace quicker than I can describe.

The first major change is that I have "become" Scandal.  I don't think of myself as Bethany anymore.  Some may believe this is just some kind of "better-than-thou" affectation, but the truth is I've grown so use to thinking of myself as "Scandal," that that's who I am.  

Things are moving slowly but steadily.  I haven't touched smack in 6 months, and control my drinking.

Sex life still sucks.  But perhaps abstinence can be good for me?  

I've been sort of kind of dating Cowboy, and I've gone on a date or two with other people.  I think . . . well, I know, actually, that I'm still figuring out what my mind wants.  I know what the body wants, but the mind is different.  Sex is good.  Sex is fun.  But sex without emotion?  Pointless.  (That's where, it seems, Antigone has gone.  And while I kind of advised Black Alice to take this path, it's because she's young.  Not that I'm all ancient and wizened, as much as she needs to loosen up, physically.)  

On the other hand, sex without emotion can be fun.  Not every act needs to be pleasing beyond the physical.  Abstinence and denial don't mean mastery - you can't tame a lion by pretending it doesn't exist or by ignoring it.  I know I've got my demons, and to master them, I've got to deal with them eventually.  

We're solidifying our cabal, and I was nominated to the leadership of the cabal by Antigone and Cowboy.  Granted, I wanted that position, but being able to get it without struggle, egos, or even mentioning I wanted it - that's good.  It's promising.  

If we induct Black Alice and Trapper into the cabal, we'll be a full Pentacle - one from each Watchtower.  That's got to be auspicious.  Maybe I should start to study the Arcana of Fate - foresee for myself what, if anything this might mean.  (It's not that I do not trust Antigone - I trust her quite implicitly - but there are times where I can't quite verbalize what I want.  At least when dealing with the supernatural.  Cowboy and Antigone focused more on the physical and real (in Cowboy's case) or on how to be a better warrior (in Antigone's case) - and in both cases it's good.  But I'm the ephemeral warlock - and the thearch.)

Speaking of which, my study of goetic magic has finally begun.  I have not yet been invited into the Key-Bearers, but Thompson has taught me the first of the Keys of Solomon.  In this case, it's called Solmonaic Authority - I harness my demons, and gain strength by making them weaker.  I need to become at least a second degree Adept before I can learn the next step - the actual conjuration and binding of these demons.  From what I can gather, I have two quite strong demons in me so far - they're related, like siblings.  Once I can master them, I can better master myself.  

I'm still nervous about approaching Cowboy to help me with my oblations.  It's the way of the Tower of Scourging - you need to prove yourself, and test yourself, and to do that, you need to use other people.  Not use, use, but test against them.  So I need to . . . well, do some things - tests of endurance, tests of skill . . .  And some of the oblations have kind of kinky overtones.  (Let's put it this way - imagine a kind of hardcore S&M session, where the "bottom" doesn't get to use a safeword.  To master the self, you have to lose control of the self.  Yeah, it's a matter of trust and experiencing real powerlessness.  And quite frankly, I don't trust most people this way.  I'm not even sure if I trust Cowboy.  Not like this - it's a scary thought.  So I'm going to work towards it slowly - games of skill, unarmed fighting, armed fighting, and then see where it goes from there.)

That was more than I planned on sharing here.  

Anyway, I've been planning our next steps - I'm not sure the Cabal as a whole would support this.  I'm not sure I'm happy about it.  I'm not going to spell it out here, not yet.  Maybe not even until the deed is done.  But if we're going to build a Consilium here, then we're going to have to take some drastic steps.  We need it to be stable - we need a leader, a hierarch, who isn't some glory hound.  That leaves maybe three people - and I don't want it.  That would be awfully presumptious of me.  Which leaves Omen or Thompson - because the third choice wants it too badly, and that makes me nervous.  Plus I'm still bitter about his protection.  

There is one path left open.  I don't like it.  I don't like helping our rivals.  We'll see how it turns out.

Later
Scandal
Look. It's me.

So. How've you been? Where've you been? I've been to hell. Literally. But I'm getting better. The first thought that came to mind - after my last little entry - was to go take care of that annoying vampire. So I got Dan and Becky all ready, and we were going to hunt him down. Except Becky vanished in the bathroom, and Dan passed out, and that left me all by my lonesome when Grayson called me. I fought it off as best as I could, and managed to grab a stake as I left. When I saw Grayson, I stabbed him. He tried to kill me. Okay, actually, there's a good chance that he actually did kill me. I wound up in hell. Not like a place of fire and brimstone, but a place of my own miserable creation. I got to encounter two different versions of myself - one as a total waste of space junkie, and one as a total heartless bitch. Neither really appealed. I also encountered a version of Armando. I wound up destroying all of them. So I wandered around hell for a bit, and soon got told how to get out - which involved binding myself to this tower, so to speak. Which I did. Then my eyes opened, and Grayson was still killing me. I thought about stabbing him, and sure enough, I stabbed him with my mind. Which was cool. He dropped me, and then Tommy - this old guy from the club - came in, filled Grayson with bullets, and told me we had to set Grayson on fire. Which we did. So now? I've been awakened. I walk the path of Scourging - the path of the Iron Tower. The path of the Mastigos. This means I can do magic - mostly stuff with mind tricks and things like that. And it doesn't matter if you don't believe me. My friends - now known as Cowboy Dan and Antigone - have also been walking their paths - Cowboy Dan saw Heaven, he says, and met angels. (No fair). Antigone got sucked into a fairy tale. All three of us are Mages - three different paths. Three different ways of approaching the world. Tommy (or Thompson) has been training me. He's on the same path as I am. He's also part of this group called the Silver Ladder - the mages who are in charge. (Mages = those who do magic.) It made sense, and I've been training there too. Thompson has told me that each person has inner demons - but that its important for us to overcome them - to be better than our weaknesses would let us be. I'm not sure I can do it, but I'm going to try. He also told me a little bit about goetic magic - the art of summoning, defeating, and then binding one's own demons. Sounds interesting - and it might be a cure for my addiction. When I'm stronger, I can force the addiction forward, and make it go away. Just another way of earning redemption. I've been drinking less - my refrigerator at home actually has fruit juice and water in it, now. I still keep beer and such there as well - the trick isn't to totally give up my addictions, but to rise above them. To become stronger. So I can have the occasional drink - but I can't rely on drinking. I can't give in to the urges that keep me weak. Other things have gotten more . . . interesting. So Dan Cowboy Dan said he loved me, which came as a shock. I almost kissed him then and there, but now that I'm on this whole self-control kick, I reigned it in. I mean, I'm not sure how I feel about him (it's complicated), but that was the first time anyone had said they loved me in a long, long time. At least, not counting drunks at the Palace or the Lounge that would slur that out while trying to cop a feel. There's issues. We're from two different worlds. And I don't know if he'll ever be able to accept mine. Like prostitution. See, I don't want to be a prostitute anymore. That was a mistake. But there are still lots of women out there, working the streets, being treated like property and not human beings. Prostutition is, as far as I'm concerned, a legitimate occupation. It makes no sense that you can give away something but not sell it. But on the other hand, the whole situation is just totally dirty at the moment. A city like Barlingtin runs on illegal things - drug deals, prostitution, things like that. And people are getting hurt. Right now, I don't trust myself to deal with the drug trade. Thompson watched as I threw out my other paraphenelia - my pipes, my stash, all of it. Does that mean I'm giving up pot? Hell no. But I'm definitely never going to just sit in my apartment and get stoned. That's no good. But I know I can run a better prostitution business. Without beating the women. Without getting them addicted to drugs. Without them having to worry about their own safety. It's simple - I make the deals. They perform the deeds. They get 40%. I get 30%. The remaining goes into things like getting them health insurance, regular HIV tests, and hiring people who can protect them. The girls make out fairly well - trust me, they aren't getting $20 from a $50 blow job right now. They're lucky if they get 10. So I double their money, take $15 myself, and the other $15 goes into the kitty. Enough girls working for me, I can get the addicts into rehab. I can get their health insurance covered. I can get them living well - higher priced clients. I can reclaim their sexuality as something they can embrace and use for strength, rather than something used to hurt them. I can help them reach power. But I'm sure Cowboy Dan would never understand that. And it's not his fault - he's got his own upbringing. I mean, in light of what I saw, I don't think I can deny the existence of higher powers. But they are up there, and the rest of us are down here, living in our own personal hells. To fix it, we've got to be strong. There's other benefits, too. I can weed out the damaged johns. The child molestors, the abusers, the rapists, the sickos - and, I dunno, either fix them or get them put away. There's so much I could do. I could find the children who are working - or in some cases, who are enslaved - and I can set them free. And as part of the Silver Ladder, I need to lead. I need to take charge of something, and show that I'm the boss. This gives me that as well - my own little empire. That I can run fairly, ethically, and somewhat morally. Plus, chasing the pimps out of the business is another bonus. The other thing is stealing. Cowboy Dan and Antigone both have problems with that. (Antigone has problems with the prostitution idea, too.) But it's just stuff - and I've seen enough people who have lots of stuff who don't appreciate what they have. I mean, sure, I stole some diamonds - but them sitting behind glass doesn't do any good. Diamonds are to be shown, and admired, and treated well. I've stolen other things as well. (I do recall that Cowboy Dan didn't have any problems when I stole that jacket for him . . .) I'd never steal from someone who couldn't afford it. I'd never steal from the poor. I'd never steal from a mom & pop store. But from a chain jeweler's store? From a business as dirty as the diamond business (which makes prostitution as it is right now look totally clean and benevolent)? Sure. I don't want to piss my friends off, but I'm still not sure they are ready for my world - or the real world, for that matter. I can only try. Stealing is just another way of getting stuff. But, at the same time, Cowboy Dan is a sweet heart. And he's sexy in that rustic macho man kind of way. He's seen 'the goods,' before, and while I'm not embarassed by it, I'm not sure if he is or not. But . . . He's seen heaven. I've seen hell. Maybe we need to balance each other out. Nothing ventured, nothing gained. So yeah, we have our date. I'm kicking myself for not kissing him when I thought about it - I think that could have spared him some humiliation. Why was I such a bitch? Other Thoughts
  1. I need to work on getting our cabal focused on making allies.
  2. We also need a name. Right now, there are three of us, but "The Trinity" sounds overly bad. "A Cowboy and Two Babes," while funny, is just tacky.
  3. I need to study this goetic magic thing more.
  4. I don't know why I can't just let Antigone be. I guess its because she's like a sister, and I want to make her better. I still want to protect her, or at least save her from herself.
  5. This city is a mess.
Until a later date, au revoir. Scandal
